comments.commentBody: President Trump's eating habits interest us because we forget he is a parvenu.  The juxtaposition of his wealth with behaviour such as eating well done steaks or KFC, the wearing of garish poorly-tied red ties and very expensive ill-fitting suits, or the gaudy decor of Trump Tower necessitate comment.  Unfortunately, like his twitter habit, the disparity between his wealth and his level of taste diverts attention from what we should be discussing: his disastrous, nationalist policies of division.

Trump's supporters in coal country (cough! wheeze!) and elsewhere in the Midwest are under the misapprehension that their Great White Hope is just standing up on behalf of the little guy.  It might be worth remembering that in his forty-something years as a real estate developer with an inherited fortune he did absolutely nothing to help that little guy.  He, too, has hired undocumented aliens and outsourced loads of manufacturing jobs (or at the very least profited "big-league"  from having his "brand" affixed to luxury items that are manufactured abroad).  His casinos welcome the "little guy," mainly for the purpose of separating him from his wallet.  The other buildings he raises- hotels, golf courses, resorts and the like- are patrolled and guarded by folks who are paid to keep the "little guy" from entering.  Let's face it: the only "little guys" that The Donald is interested in are the ones whose skin colors and features don't mesh well with his own.  Keep them out and maybe the folks in Wisconsin and Ohio and western Pennsylvania will have more jobs to choose from.  And if they'd rather not pick fruit and clean toilets, well whose fault is that?

Not to mention his long history of cheating the small businesses who work on his projects - that doesn't look like championing the little guy to me! I'm just grateful my dad, running his small business in CT, never had cause to work for Trump.

Interesting, too, that the number of abortions performed in America has decreased since ACA as more women have access to healthcare and contraception. This begs the question why would Republicans want to destroy a program that actually decreases the need for abortion?

This article is too narrow. It should be about all workers and all compensation. Workers should not be chained to a company or government. These complex pensions and other retirement schemes are not transparent. Neither employees or taxpayers understand them. Their are hidden risks and fees.

Workers' compensation - including pensions and any other retirement funds - should be completely under their own control.

ObamaCare funds are being used to pay for abortions. That is yet another lie Obama told. Ostensibly, his executive order specified that if abortion was covered by insurance, the premium for abortion coverage had to be specifically broken out on the monthly billing and government funds could not be used to subsidize it. That was too much trouble, so the insurers didn't bother to breakout the charges and HHS didn't enforce it. They were too busy suing the Little Sisters.

You are absolutely correct that the women's health services clinics can continue to qualify for federal funding if they separate legally from abortion services. The reason they refuse to do so is that the federal funds are subsidizing the abortions.

Who needs Affirmative Action when, as Ms. DeVos so kindly pointed out, blacks have the choice to go to black universities.

But, Mr. Douthat, it's really disingenuous for you not to mention Affirmative Action for the 1%.

Here is the perfect example of that from The Guardian:
Daniel Golden's 2006 book, “The Price of Admission.” exposed a grubby secret of American higher education: "that the rich buy their under-achieving children’s way into elite universities with massive, tax-deductible donations. It reported that real estate developer Charles Kushner pledged $2.5 million to Harvard in 1998, not long before his son Jared was admitted to the prestigious Ivy League school. At the time, Harvard accepted about 1 of every 9 applicants. (Nowadays, it only takes 1 out of 20.)

I also quoted administrators at Jared’s high school, who described him as a less than stellar student and expressed dismay at Harvard’s decision.

“There was no way anybody in the administrative office of the school thought he would on the merits get into Harvard,” a former official at Frisch School in Paramus, NJ, told me. “His GPA did not warrant it, his SAT scores did not warrant it. We thought for sure, there was no way this was going to happen. Then, lo and behold, Jared was accepted. It was a little bit disappointing because there were at the time other kids we thought should really get in on the merits, and they did not.”

This book was written in 2006, and look where this "Action" got Jared Kushner.

Well affirmative action does the EXACT same thing. In my freshman year, my roomate was a Navajo, full blooded. He got in due to affirmative action, and he was totally unprepared for MIT. He failed every single one of his classes, and dropped out after the first year. Remember. the whole point of affirmative action is to give extra points based on race, not on preparedneas for college.
Let good schools get expansion money by selling some slots.
We would have hacked the phones. So maybe they are not so foolish.

Admirable! I never thought I'd say that, having endured a year of what appeared to be fawning over the dumpster fire of vanity, but this nails it.

How can Van Jones of all people think Trump is presidential if he doesn't violate the norms of appearance and behavior, while he tramples on civilization and humanity? And calling out Bush was brilliant: "It will always be too soon to laugh about" our demented ill-conceived and poorly executive adventures in the Middle East.

Trump is the ultimate recruiting poster for terrorists of all stripes, and that includes Bannon and the white supremacist followers and adolescent malcontents of the internet insult universe.

We are in genuine danger, we humans, and we need to acknowledge that the planet we inhabit is made of real stuff. Poisoning it and turning it into a wasteland is not good for us humans. Encouraging us to blame others for our problems is almost as bad.

There is no enduring and no accepting of the dumpster fire that is a path forward for us as humans. It only works if we realize that as apex predators it is past time for earth to reject our greedy ways. Even the kleptocrats will suffer and realize in the end.
I don't feel alone when I read opinion like this.

Nick’s arguments resonate to one degree or another with half the country and are opposed, to one degree or another, by the other half. It’s inevitable that approaches to finding solutions are enslaved to other issues more highly prioritized by Americans, such as economic wellbeing, a strong defense, secure borders and the MANY other things that motivated just enough in just the right places to elect Trump and an undivided Republican Congress. Mrs. Clinton wouldn’t have improved the situation because she couldn’t dictate a solution – it requires funding, which requires Congress, and we’d be precisely where we are now.

Nick’s arguments aren’t even new but old. Much of America has rejected them for reasons of religion or views on the appropriate role of government that don’t include paying to keep 17-year-old girls from becoming pregnant – particularly when what he proposes undoubtedly frees 17-year-old girls (and, depressingly to many, 14-year-olds as well) from energetic sex lives without consequence other than a likely lessening of the need for condoms and the consequent increase in the incidence of STDs.

Many Americans like me want to see continued funding of non-controversial healthcare services to indigent women. Some Republicans like me don’t see major problems with providing birth control services and even abortion services, but this simply isn’t going to happen in today’s America. We need to find another way, such as charitable funding of controversial services.
There is nothing controversial about contraception, except among religious extremists and maniacs.

"non-controversial healthcare services to indigent women"? So women should have access only to health care that is not "controversial"? But men? What about men? They get access to all health care?

Your 17-year-old girl would not be getting pregnant at all if it weren't for a 17-year-old boy (or older) who can't keep his pants zipped. What do you propose we do about that?

It isn't about making amends for our past history of slavery, but rather it is about striving to live up to the promise of America; that all men are created equal. As long as there continues to be a wink and a nod to bigotry, as long there is a back door effort to deny the right to vote, until the confederate battle flag finally disappears from back of rural pick-up trucks, we will continue to require laws defining equal justice, special admissions and preferences, and a careful accounting to assure the minimal existence of balance.
Actually, it *is* also about restitution for slavery.
Yeah, paying $130,000/year bureaucrats to censor redneck pickup trucks will really produce love in all our hearts.

This accusation is just a diversionary tactic. The Jeff Sessions fiasco was gaining traction, and Trump needed to distract the public and the media away from the notion that Sessions was colluding with the Russians, and then lied to the Senate during the confirmation hearings.

The solution ? Make an outrageous statement about Obama, get everybody in a tizzy, and forget that Sessions committed perjury. Works like a charm.

And if you haven't noticed, this is not the first time Trump has used this tactic. In fact, it has become standard operating procedure for him.
ya think??

How about this: the media -- or just NYT, Washington Post, CNN and MSNBC -- TOTALLY ignore the man's tweets.  This accomplishes two things: (1) He will no longer be able to distract from the real issues when he's in a hole, and (2) He will go insane mad for being ignored.

Correct but the United States Attorney General can provided a FISA warrant is issued.  A legitimate denial by former President Obama but silence from FBI Director and former AG Lynch?  What is the real truth????

She told you he is not temperamentally fit to be a president. She told you he is a puppet of Russia. She cited seventeen national intelligence agencies that concluded that russia is meddling with the election. You did not listen, you did not believe. Sorry.

While I disagree with Mr. Sasse on numerous issues of policy, he must be lauded for being one of the few Republican grownups in the room.  That Mr. Trump isn't it routinely denounced for his fantastical delusions by all of Congress is shameful.
He is so pathetic and I am sure that such fake news was picked up by DJT from infowars, breitbart, etc...

Chunga's Revenge... GREAT ALBUM! I agree with you on the Big Brother Surveillance State stuff... But, your attack on President Obama is without fact and therefore, farcical...

Frank Z would be ashamed. Please change your name... "O'Reilly's Revenge" might work for you.

"In short, Obama would have definitely done such a thing, considering his disingenuous personality, and Trump is right in accusing him."

Wait- didn't you just spend a column on the "no credible evidences of the Russian hacking" - yet, in short, you come to this conclusion?
Seriously - you believe Trump? The man who lies 4 times a sentence? Get a grip on reality.

Trying to reason with this selfish ill-tempered man isn't going to work. Neither he nor his Breitbart reading advisers is going to read it.

Unfortunately he's here to stay unless impeached before his term is up. The irony of the aggregate of his ill-advised policies is that the people most affected will likely be his most die-hard supported.

They and Trump have no knowledge of economics, history, or the law of unintended consequences: to wit, extremist actions and over-protectionism have long been proven to produce the opposite effect and hurt the very people Trump is promising to help.

The normalization of Trump by an MSM that is always looking for a story of redemption is my greatest fear.

W cleverly laid low when he left office so his legacy of a blown up economy and a Middle East ablaze would more easily be forgotten and eventually, forgiven. After eight years, he's emerged to be embraced by much of the pundit class and the public.

Trump has been an abomination of a president, making a mess of everything in less than eight weeks and after one TelePrompTer speech delivered more calmly than usual, the naive, the shallow and the gullible embraced it.

"People were relieved at Calm Trump. But really, that’s more potentially dangerous because if he learns how to behave in a more measured, charming way on the surface, he can put a disarming face on harsh policies or duplicitous practices.

If he seems less like a mad man aiming to rip everything apart, he can more easily rip everything apart" like the government, established norms and values, our democracy &

A friend of mine implored me to give Trump a chance because the MSM was treating him unfairly. She gets her news from Facebook. I reminded her that In 2003, she told me if I didn't stop speaking out against the war in Iraq, people would think I was unpatriotic. I told her she was wrong then and she is wrong now because Trump has already run out of chances.

I'm already tired of the media's fawning over Trump's speech and the rehabilitation of W.

Is this to prepare us for the 2020 Jeb Bush campaign? Sorry -- I'm still not going to vote for Jeb. I wanted TRUMP over Jeb. I was a big fan of the Apprentice and was pleased that he told the truth about the Weapons of Mass Destruction. Who knew that he did that because he had no filter?

Once he started talking about his sexual prowess at the debates, comparing his "hands" with Rubio, I knew that this candidacy had denigrated into the ground but somehow he won the Presidency.

So now the media is trying to rehabilitate Trump, too, because he read a speech.

By the way, I did like Trump but was never going to actually vote for him. I'm a Democrat.
Please. Please. Tell me the Twitter was planted by some maniacal opponent bent on painting Trump as a loose cannon crazy, totally unfit to be President.

Fun, but fast puzzle. I caught the element abbreviations on the U in NUCLEAR REACTOR. After working at the Hanford Site for 24 years, I should remember the abbreviation for uranium.

Enjoy your Sunday. Thanks for a fun puzzle.
Isotope so!

it's odd, Bruce, that while you say that "none of us" have facts, you do seem to know that Obama's subordinates would order a phone tap.

How can that be?
